Neutrophil: Neutrophils are the most abundant white blood cells, playing a key role in acute inflammation and defense against infection.
Endocrine: Endocrine cells in the pancreas secrete hormones such as insulin, glucagon, and somatostatin to regulate blood glucose levels.
Neuron: Neurons are specialized cells that transmit electrical and chemical signals throughout the nervous system.
Adipocyte: Adipocytes are fat-storing cells that accumulate energy in the form of triglycerides and regulate metabolic homeostasis.
Malignant: Malignant cells are cancerous cells characterized by uncontrolled proliferation and tissue invasion, often associated with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
Epithelial: Epithelial cells form the lining of pancreatic ducts and acini, and are involved in secretion, absorption, and structural integrity.
Myocyte: Myocytes are contractile muscle cells responsible for generating force and movement in tissues.
Macrophage: Macrophages are immune cells that engulf pathogens and debris, and coordinate the inflammatory response.
Dendritic: Dendritic cells are antigen-presenting cells that link innate and adaptive immunity by activating T cells.
Endothelial: Endothelial cells line the interior of blood and lymphatic vessels, maintaining vascular integrity and regulating exchange.
Fibroblast: Fibroblasts are connective tissue cells that synthesize extracellular matrix and collagen to support tissue structure and repair.
T_cell: T cells are lymphocytes that mediate adaptive immunity, including cytotoxic and helper functions against infected or abnormal cells.
Plasma: Plasma cells are differentiated B lymphocytes that produce and secrete large volumes of antibodies.
Mast: Mast cells are immune cells that release histamine and other mediators during allergic and inflammatory responses.
Schwann: Schwann cells are glial cells that insulate peripheral nerve fibers by forming the myelin sheath.
Pericyte: Pericytes are support cells that wrap around capillaries and small vessels, contributing to vascular stability and blood-brain barrier maintenance.
NK_cell: Natural killer (NK) cells are cytotoxic lymphocytes that rapidly target virus-infected or tumor cells without prior sensitization.
B_cell: B cells are lymphocytes responsible for antibody production and antigen presentation, essential for humoral immunity.
